ai-mn92:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Northern Āpaṇas together with a large Saṅgha of 1,250 mendicants when he arrived at a town of the Northern Āpaṇas named Āpaṇa.
ai-mn92:2.2_0: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—has arrived at Āpaṇa, together with a large Saṅgha of 1,250 mendicants.
ai-mn92:2.4_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-mn92:2.5_0: He realizes with his own insight this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known to others.
ai-mn92:2.6_0: He teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.
ai-mn92:2.7_0: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”
ai-mn92:3.1_0: So Keṇiya approached the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-mn92:3.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-mn92:3.3_0: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching,
ai-mn92:3.4_0: Then he said to the Buddha,
ai-mn92:3.5_0: “Good Gotama, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me, together with the Sangha of monks.”
ai-mn92:3.6_0: When he said this, the Buddha said to him,
ai-mn92:3.7_0: “The Sangha is large, Keṇiya. There are twelve hundred and fifty monks. Moreover, you have confidence in the brahmins.”
ai-mn92:3.9_0: “Master Gotama, even though the mendicant Saṅgha was devoted to Master Gotama,
ai-mn92:3.10_0: Would Master Gotama together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me?”
ai-mn92:3.12_0: “The Sangha is large, Keṇiya. There are twelve hundred and fifty monks. Moreover, you have confidence in the brahmins.”
ai-mn92:3.13_0: and a third time Keṇiya asked the Buddha to accept a meal offering.
ai-mn92:3.14_0: “Master Gotama, even though the mendicant Saṅgha was devoted to Master Gotama,
ai-mn92:3.15_0: Would Master Gotama together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me?”
ai-mn92:3.16_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-mn92:4.1_0: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Keṇiya got up from his seat and went to his own hermitage.
ai-mn92:4.1_1: and after approaching he addressed his friends and colleagues, relatives and kin, (saying):
ai-mn92:4.3_0: “The ascetic Gotama has been invited by me for tomorrow’s meal together with the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-mn92:4.4_0: Please help me with the preparations.”
ai-mn92:4.5_0: “Yes, sir,” they replied. Some dug ovens, some chopped wood, some washed dishes, some set out a water jar, and some spread out seats.
ai-mn92:4.6_0: Meanwhile, Keṇiya set up the pavilion himself.
ai-mn92:5.1_0: Now at that time the brahmin Sela was residing in Āpaṇa. He had mastered the three Vedas, together with their vocabularies, ritual, phonology and etymology, and the testament as fifth. He knew philology and grammar, and was well versed in cosmology and the marks of a great man. And he was teaching three hundred students to recite the hymns.
ai-mn92:6.1_0: Now at that time Keṇiya was devoted to Sela.
ai-mn92:6.2_0: Then Sela, while going for a walk escorted by the three hundred students, approached Keṇiya’s hermitage.

ai-mn92:7.2_0: “Keṇiya, is your son or daughter being married? Or are you setting up a big sacrifice? Or has King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha been invited for tomorrow’s meal?”
ai-mn92:8.1_0: “There is no marriage, Sela, and the king is not coming.
ai-mn92:8.2_0: Rather, I am setting up a big sacrifice.
ai-mn92:8.3_0: The ascetic Gotama has gone forth from a Sakyan family—has arrived at Āpaṇa, together with a large Saṅgha of 1,250 mendicants.
ai-mn92:8.5_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-mn92:8.6_0: He has been invited by me for tomorrow’s meal together with the mendicant Saṅgha.”
ai-mn92:9.1_0: “Mister Keṇiya, did you say ‘the awakened one’?”
ai-mn92:9.3_0: “Mister Keṇiya, did you say ‘the awakened one’?”
ai-mn92:10.2_0: “It’s hard to even find the word ‘awakened one’ in the world.
ai-mn92:10.3_0: The thirty-two marks of a great man have been handed down in our hymns. A great man who possesses these has only two possible destinies, no other.
ai-mn92:10.4_0: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch.
ai-mn92:10.5_0: He has the following seven treasures:
ai-mn92:10.6_0: the wheel, the elephant, the horse, the jewel, the woman, the treasurer, and the counselor as the seventh treasure.
ai-mn92:10.7_0: He has over a thousand sons who are valiant and heroic, crushing the armies of his enemies.
ai-mn92:10.8_0: After conquering this land girt by sea, he reigns by principle, without rod or sword.
ai-mn92:10.9_0: But if he goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, he becomes a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, who draws back the veil from the world.”
ai-mn92:11.1_0: “But Keṇiya, where is the Blessed One at present, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha?”
ai-mn92:11.2_0: When he said this, Keṇiya pointed with his right arm and said,
ai-mn92:11.3_0: “There, Mister Sela, at that line of blue forest.”
ai-mn92:12.1_0: Then Sela together with three hundred students went to the Buddha.
ai-mn92:12.4_0: For the Buddhas are intimidating, like a lion living alone.
ai-mn92:12.5_0: When I’m consulting with the ascetic Gotama, don’t interrupt.

ai-mn92:13.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.

ai-mn92:15.6_0: Why don’t I extoll him in his presence with fitting verses?”

ai-mn92:25.1_0: And when the night had passed Keṇiya had a variety of delicious foods prepared in his own home. Then he had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,
ai-mn92:25.2_0: saying: “It is time, dear Gotama, the meal is ready.”
ai-mn92:25.3_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to Keṇiya’s hermitage.
ai-mn92:25.3_1: and after approaching he sat down on the prepared seat, together with the Community of monks.
ai-mn92:25.4_0: Then Keṇiya served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods.
ai-mn92:25.5_0: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, Keṇiya took a low seat and sat to one side.
ai-mn92:25.6_0: The Buddha expressed his appreciation with these verses.
ai-mn92:26.1_0: “The foremost of sacrifices is offering to the sacred flame;
ai-mn92:26.3_0: of humans, the king is the foremost;
ai-mn92:26.4_0: the ocean’s the foremost of rivers;
ai-mn92:26.5_0: The moon is the best in the night sky,
ai-mn92:26.6_0: the sun is the foremost of lights;
ai-mn92:26.7_0: for those making offerings, desiring merit,
ai-mn92:26.9_0: And the Buddha got up from his seat and left.
ai-mn92:27.1_0: Then Venerable Sela and his assembly, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. They lived having achieved with their own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-mn92:27.2_0: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
ai-mn92:27.3_0: And Venerable Sela together with his assembly became perfected.
ai-mn92:28.1_0: Then Sela with his assembly went to see the Buddha.
ai-mn92:28.1_1: and after approaching and arranging his robe on one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and addressed him in verse:
ai-mn92:28.3_0: we went for refuge, O seer.
ai-mn92:28.4_0: In these seven days, Blessed One,
ai-mn92:28.5_0: we’ve become tamed in your teaching.
ai-mn92:28.6_0: You are the Buddha, you are the Teacher,
ai-mn92:28.8_0: you have cut off the underlying tendencies,

ai-mn92:28.16_0: Stretch out your feet, great hero:
